greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of linear chord diagrams on 2n vertices with one marked chord such that exactly k of the remaining n-1 chords cross the marked chord.
link: Donovan Young, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9870 (Rows 1..140).
Donovan Young, A critical quartet for queuing couples, arXiv:2007.13868 [math.CO], 2020.
example: For n = 2 and k = 1, let the four vertices be {1,2,3,4}. The marked chord can be either (1,3), and so crossed once by (2,4), or (2,4), and so crossed once by (1,3). Hence T(2,1) = 2.
xref: Row sums are n*A001147(n) for n > 0.
First column is A233481(n) for n > 0.
Leading diagonal is A000142(n) for n > 0.
Sub-leading diagonal is n*A000142(n) for n > 1.
results.author: _Donovan Young_, Jul 29 2020
